intro: Conceveiba megalophylla, commonly known as the giant leaf Conceveiba, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in length. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and are clustered in terminal inflorescences. The plant is adapted to humid, shaded environments and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
